required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study to Evaluate Plasma Treatment of Onychomycosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Pilot Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Preliminary Efficacy of the Plasma Treatment System in Treating Onychomycosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of treating human toenails with atmospheric plasma (MOE Antimicrobial Plasma Treatment System) and get an initial evaluation of the efficacy of this treatment for toenail fungus (onychomycosis).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of reported adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 6 months post-treatment

arm_group.description: Apply plasma to great toenail for up to 20 minutes, 1X/week for 3 weeks

intervention.description: Plasma applied to great toenail 1X/week for three weeks
